Video qwality is very great. Sound Qwality is very bad. Not because of compression but because it comes from a Bluray, which is originaly engineered for specific sound protocol (5.1, THX whatsoever). The result is that it waste all the movie if you are watching it on a low qwality home cinema (laptop, usual TV). It's complete nonesense.

The yifY team knows about picture compression, but gets completely deaf, and it gets worser every month.

Why using Bluray as the original support for a 800Mo rip. It's a beginner mistake! DVD instead would have been a much more reasonable choice due to the compression loss. The results looks the same without the side effects (qwadriphonie, 720p, useless stuff that do not witness of the picture/sound qwality at all where they just notify the protocol)

Agreed I miss aXXo (though I don't miss DivX):

YIFY makes quality torrents to be sure, and very well seeded because they are well known.

The image quality really has been turned down significantly lately.

720p is not worth the resolution at this size. If you want a nice 720p picture, go with something about 1.6 to 2.4gb in size.
For 811mb you might as well be watching a DVD rip.
(And yes, if the file's this small, it's probably mostly people with smaller setups downloading it, so 160 or 192kbps 2ch stereo would be nice)

Bottom line: YIFY 800mb rips are great for watching on a small screen, but I'd look elsewhere for collection-quality BrRips these days. YIFY seems to now put small-size over quality.
